content.question: ​The rational function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is expressed as the quotient of two polynomial functions <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator f open parentheses x close parentheses over denominator g open parentheses x close parentheses end fraction"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfrac></math>. The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 6 x cubed minus x squared plus 60 x minus 25"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>60</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>25</mn></math>. If the graph of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> has a slant asymptote of <math alttext="y equals 2 x minus 1"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, which of the following describes <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> has degree <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> with leading coefficient <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>.
<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> has degree <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> with leading coefficient <math alttext="12"><mn>12</mn></math>.
​<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> has degree <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> with leading coefficient <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>.
​<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> has degree <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> with leading coefficient <math alttext="12"><mn>12</mn></math>.

content.answer: ​<math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> has degree <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> with leading coefficient <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
